title: GPU based sensor update rates:  throttled by slowest active sensor

content.raw:
Simultaneously subscribing to 2 or more GPU based sensosrs, e.g.

    rostopic hz /multisense_sl/laser/scan

and

    rostopic hz rostopic hz /multisense_sl/camera/left/image_raw

will eventually bring both sensor update rates down to the slowest of the group (sometimes it takes a minute or so for them to synchronize).  Test on SL machine also shows both laser and camera ends up at 30Hz if listening to both streams.

Maybe a `SensorManager::SensorContainer::RunLoop` synchronization based bug since reducing camera pixel size does not help.
content.html:
Simultaneously subscribing to 2 or more GPU based sensosrs, e.g.

rostopic hz /multisense_sl/laser/scan

and

rostopic hz rostopic hz /multisense_sl/camera/left/image_raw

will eventually bring both sensor update rates down to the slowest of the group (sometimes it takes a minute or so for them to synchronize). Test on SL machine also shows both laser and camera ends up at 30Hz if listening to both streams.

Maybe a SensorManager::SensorContainer::RunLoop synchronization based bug since reducing camera pixel size does not help.
